question: Who has been sworn-in as the new Chief Justice of the Bombay High Court?
explanation: Justice Naresh Harishchandra Patil has been sworn-in as the new Chief Justice of the Bombay High Court.  Maharashtra Governor C Vidyasagar Rao administered the oath of office to Justice Patil at a brief ceremony held at Raj Bhavan. The Bombay High Court is one of the oldest High Courts of India and its principle seat is at Mumbai. Its jurisdiction covers the states of Maharashtra and Goa, and the Union Territories of Daman and Diu and Dadra and Nagar Haveli.
